intro: Boehmeria hatusimae, commonly known as Japanese arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant is notable for its starchy roots, which are used as a food source in some regions. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its fibrous stalks are also used in traditional crafts and textiles.
